text: Psalm 119
Aleph\f + \fr 118:29 \ft \xt Psalm 119 \ft is an acrostic psalm, with twenty-two stanzas corresponding to the letters of the Hebrew alphabet \f*
Blessed \add are those whose\add* way is blameless,
who walk in the law of Yahweh.
Blessed \add are\add* those who keep his testimonies;
they seek him with a whole heart.
They also do no wrong;
they walk in his ways.
You have commanded\f + \fr 119:4 \ft Perhaps emphatic; Hebrew “you, you have commanded” \f* your precepts,
that \add we\add* should keep \add them\add* diligently.
Oh that my ways were steadfast,
to keep your statutes!
Then I would not be ashamed
when I look to all your commands.
I will give you thanks with an upright heart,
when I learn your righteous laws.
I will heed your statutes;
do not utterly forsake me.
Beth
How can a young man keep his way pure?
By taking heed according to your word.
With my whole heart I have sought you;
do not let me stray from your commands.
In my heart I have hidden your word,\f + \fr 119:11 \ft Or “promise” \f*
so that I may not sin against you.
Blessed \add are\add* you, O Yahweh.
Teach me your statutes.
With my lips I have told \add of\add*
all the ordinances of your mouth.
In the way of your testimonies I have rejoiced
as \add I would\add* over all riches.
I will meditate on your precepts
and look at\f + \fr 119:15 \ft That is, “examine” \f* your ways.
I will take delight in your statutes;
I will not forget your word.
Gimel
Deal bountifully with your servant, that I may live
and heed your word.
Uncover my eyes, that I may look at\f + \fr 119:18 \ft That is, “examine” \f*
wonderful things from your law.
I \add am\add* a sojourner on the earth;\f + \fr 119:19 \ft That is, “here for a short time” \f*
do not hide your commands from me.
My soul is crushed with longing
for your ordinances at all times.
You rebuke \add the\add* arrogant, \add the\add* accursed,
who stray from your commands.
⸤Remove from⸥\f + \fr 119:22 \ft Literally “Roll off of” \f* me scorn and contempt,
for I have kept your testimonies.
Even \add though\add* princes sit \add and\add* speak against me,
your servant meditates on your statutes.
Your testimonies \add are\add* my delight,
⸤my counselors⸥.\f + \fr 119:24 \ft Literally “the men of my counsel” \f*
Daleth
My soul clings to the dust;
revive me according to your word.
I told of my ways, and you answered me;
teach me your statutes.
Make me understand the way of your precepts,
that I may meditate on your wonderful things.
My soul weeps\f + \fr 119:28 \ft Or “is sleepless” \f* because of grief;
strengthen me according to your word.
Remove from me \add the\add* deceptive way,
and graciously give me your law.
I have chosen \add the\add* faithful way;
I have set your ordinances \add before me\add*.
I cling to your testimonies;
O Yahweh, do not let me be put to shame.
I will run the way of your commands,
for you will enlarge my heart.\f + \fr 119:32 \ft That is, “give greater understanding” \f*
Heʼ
Teach me, O Yahweh, the way of your statutes,
and I will keep it to the end.
Give me understanding, that I may keep your law
and heed it with \add my\add* whole heart.
Cause me to walk in the path of your commands,
for I delight in it.
Incline my heart to your testimonies,
and not to \add dishonest\add* gain.
Turn away my eyes from looking at \add what is\add* worthless;
revive me in your ways.
Fulfill your word\f + \fr 119:38 \ft Or “your promise” \f* to your servant,
which \add is\add* to \add bring about\add* a reverence for you.
Turn away my disgrace that I dread,
for your ordinances \add are\add* good.
Look, I have longed for your precepts;
revive me in your righteousness.
Waw
Let your acts of loyal love also come to me, O Yahweh,
your salvation according to your word.\f + \fr 119:41 \ft Or “your promise” \f*
Then I will have an answer \add for the\add* one who taunts me,
for I trust your word.
And do not snatch \add the\add* word of truth utterly from my mouth,
for I hope in your ordinances.
So I will heed your law continually,
forever and ever.
And I will go about ⸤freely⸥,\f + \fr 119:45 \ft Literally “in the wide place” \f*
for I have sought your precepts.
And I will speak of your testimonies before kings,
and will not be ashamed.
And I will take delight in your commands,
which I love.
And I will lift up my hands\f + \fr 119:48 \ft Hebrew “palms” \f* to your commands, which I love,
and I will meditate on your statutes.
Zayin
Remember \add your\add* word to your servant,
upon which you have caused me to hope.
This \add is\add* my comfort in my misery:
that your word\f + \fr 119:50 \ft Or “your promise” \f* preserves my life.
\add The\add* arrogant utterly deride me;
I have not turned aside from your law.
I remember your ordinances of old, O Yahweh,
and I take comfort.
Rage seizes me because of \add the\add* wicked,
those who forsake your law.
Your statutes have been my songs
in the house of my sojourning.
I remember your name in the night, O Yahweh,
and I heed your law.
This has been mine,
that I have kept your precepts.
Heth
Yahweh \add is\add* my portion;
I intend to heed your words.
I ⸤seek your favor⸥\f + \fr 119:58 \ft Literally “entreat your face” \f* with my whole heart;
be gracious \add to\add* me according to your word.\f + \fr 119:58 \ft Or “your promise” \f*
I think about my ways,
and turn my feet to your testimonies.
I hurry and do not delay
to heed your commands.
\add The\add* cords of \add the\add* wicked surround me,
\add but\add* I do not forget your law.
\add In the\add* middle of \add the\add* night I rise to give you thanks,
because of your righteous ordinances.
I \add am\add* a companion of all \add who\add* fear you
and heed your precepts.
The earth, O Yahweh, is full of your loyal love.
Teach me your statutes.
Teth
You have dealt well with your servant,
O Yahweh, according to your word.
Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
for I believe your commands.
Before I was afflicted, I was going astray,
but now I heed your word.
You \add are\add* good and do good;
teach me your statutes.
\add The\add* arrogant smear me with lies;\f + \fr 119:69 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f*
I keep your precepts with \add my\add* whole heart.
Their heart \add is\add* insensitive like fat;\f + \fr 119:70 \ft See \xt Isa 6:10 \ft for a similar idea, but a different word for “fat” \f*
As for me, I take delight in your law.
\add It is\add* good for me that I was afflicted,
so that I might learn your statutes.
The law of your mouth \add is\add* better to me
than thousands of gold and silver \add coins\add*.
Yod
Your hands have made me and established me;
give me understanding that I may learn your commands.
Those who fear you will see me and be glad,
because I hope in your word.
I know, O Yahweh, that your judgments \add are\add* right,
and \add that\add* in faithfulness you afflicted me.
Please let your loyal love comfort me,
according to your word\f + \fr 119:76 \ft Or “your promise” \f* to your servant.
Let your mercies come \add to\add* me, that I may live,
for your law \add is\add* my delight.
Let the arrogant be put to shame,
because they have wronged me \add with\add* lies.\f + \fr 119:78 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f*
As for me, I will meditate on your precepts.
Let those who fear you turn to me,
even those who know\f + \fr 119:79 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* your testimonies.
May my heart be blameless in your statutes,
so that I may not be ashamed.
Kaph
My soul languishes for your salvation;
I hope in your word.
My eyes long for\f + \fr 119:82 \ft Or “long \fq to see \ft ” \f* your word,\f + \fr 119:82 \ft Or “your promise” \f*
saying, “When will you comfort me?”
For I have become like a wineskin in \add the\add* smoke,
\add yet\add* I have not forgotten your statutes.
How many \add are\add* the days of your servant?
When will you execute justice against those who persecute me?
\add The\add* arrogant have dug pits\f + \fr 119:85 \ft That is, traps \f* for me,
which \add is\add* not according to\f + \fr 119:85 \ft Or “who \fq are \ft not in accord with” \f* your law.
All your commands \add are\add* faithful.
They persecute me deceitfully; help me!
They have almost destroyed me on the earth,
but I have not forsaken your precepts.
According to your loyal love preserve me alive,
so that I may heed the testimony from your mouth.
Lamed
Forever, O Yahweh,
your word ⸤is settled⸥\f + \fr 119:89 \ft Literally “stands firm” \f* in heaven.
Your faithfulness \add endures\add* ⸤throughout all generations⸥.\f + \fr 119:90 \ft Literally “for a generation and a generation” \f*
You have established \add the\add* earth and it stands.
By your ordinances they stand today,
for all \add are\add* your servants.
Unless your law \add had been\add* my delight,
then I would have perished in my misery.
I will not ever forget your precepts,
for by them you revive me.\f + \fr 119:93 \ft Or “give me life” \f*
I \add am\add* yours. Save me,
for I have sought your precepts.
For me \add the\add* wicked \add lie in\add* wait to destroy me.
I give attention to your testimonies.
I have seen a limit to every perfection;\f + \fr 119:96 \ft The meaning of this line is uncertain. \f*
your command \add is\add* very broad.
Mem
How I love your law!
The whole day it \add is\add* my meditation.
Your commands make me wiser than my enemies,
because they\f + \fr 119:98 \ft Hebrew “it \fq is \ft ” \f* \add are\add* ever with me.
I have more insight than all my teachers,
for your testimonies \add are\add* my meditation.
I understand more than \add the\add* elders,
for I keep your precepts.
I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
so that I may heed your word.
I have not turned aside from your ordinances,
for you have taught me.
How smooth\f + \fr 119:103 \ft Or “sweet” \f* \add are\add* your words\f + \fr 119:103 \ft Hebrew “word” \f* to my palate,
more than honey in my mouth.
From your precepts I get understanding,
therefore I hate every false way.
Nun
Your word \add is\add* a lamp to my feet
and a light to my path.
I have sworn \add an oath\add* and confirmed \add it\add*,
to heed ⸤your righteous ordinances⸥.\f + \fr 119:106 \ft Literally “the ordinances of your righteousness” \f*
I am very much afflicted;
O Yahweh, revive me according to your word.
Please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Yahweh,
and teach me your ordinances.
My life \add is\add* ⸤in danger⸥\f + \fr 119:109 \ft Literally “in my hand” \f* continually,
yet I do not forget your law.
\add The\add* wicked have laid a snare for me,
yet I do not wander from your precepts.
I have taken as my own your testimonies forever,
for they \add are\add* the joy of my heart.
I have inclined my heart to do your statutes
forever, to the end.
Samek
I hate ⸤the double-minded⸥,\f + \fr 119:113 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft divided” \f*
but I love your law.
You \add are\add* my hiding place and my shield;
I hope in your word.
Turn aside from me, \add you\add* evildoers,
for I will keep the commands of my God.
Sustain me according to your word,\f + \fr 119:116 \ft Or “promise” \f* that I may live,
and do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
Uphold me, that I may be delivered,
and have regard for your statutes continually.
You reject all \add who\add* stray from your statutes,
for their deceit \add is\add* a breach of faith.
You remove all the wicked of \add the\add* earth \add like\add* dross,
therefore I love your testimonies.
My flesh trembles for fear of you,
and I am afraid of your judgments.
ʽAyin
I have done justice and righteousness;\f + \fr 119:121 \ft Or “done \fq what is \ft proper and right” \f*
do not leave me to my oppressors.
Pledge good for your servant;
do not let \add the\add* arrogant oppress me.
My eyes long for\f + \fr 119:123 \ft Or “long \fq to see \ft ” \f* your salvation,
and your righteous word.\f + \fr 119:123 \ft Or “promise” \f*
Deal with your servant according to your loyal love,
and teach me your statutes.
I \add am\add* your servant; give me understanding,
that I may know your statutes.
\add It is\add* time for Yahweh to act,\f + \fr 119:126 \ft Or “time to act, O Yahweh” \f*
\add for\add* they have broken your law.
Therefore I love your commands
more than gold, even fine gold.
Therefore all \add your\add* precepts of everything I regard as right;
I hate every false way.
Pe
Your testimonies \add are\add* miracles,
therefore my soul keeps them.
The unfolding of your words gives light,
giving understanding to \add the\add* simple.
I open my mouth and pant,
because I long for your commands.
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
as \add is\add* proper for those who love your name.
Direct my steps in your word,\f + \fr 119:133 \ft Or “through your promise” \f*
and do not let any iniquity gain power over me.
Redeem me from \add the\add* oppression of humankind,
that I may heed your precepts.
Shine your face on your servant,
and teach me your statutes.
Streams of water flow down \add from\add* my eyes,
because \add people\add* do not heed your law.
Tsade
You \add are\add* righteous, O Yahweh,
and your ordinances \add are\add* upright.
You have ordained your testimonies \add in\add* righteousness,
and \add in\add* exceeding faithfulness.
My zeal consumes me,
because my enemies have forgotten your words.
Your word \add is\add* very pure,
and your servant loves it.
I \add am\add* small and despised,
\add yet\add* I do not forget your precepts.
Your righteousness \add is\add* an everlasting righteousness,
and your law \add is\add* truth.
Trouble and anguish have found me;
your commands delight me.
The righteousness of your testimonies \add is\add* forever;
give me understanding that I may live.
Qoph
I call with \add my\add* whole heart; answer me, O Yahweh.
I will keep your statutes.
I call to you. Save me,
and I will heed your testimonies.
I rise early in the dawn and cry for help;
I hope in your word.\f + \fr 119:147 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f*
My eyes anticipate \add the\add* night watches,
that \add I may\add* meditate on your word.
Hear my voice according to your loyal love;
O Yahweh, preserve my life according to your justice.
\add Those who\add* pursue a \add wicked\add* purpose draw near;
they are far from your law.
You \add are\add* near, O Yahweh,
and all your commands \add are\add* truth.
Concerning your testimonies, I knew long ago
that you have established them forever.
Resh
See my misery and rescue me,
for I do not forget your law.
Plead my cause and redeem me;
preserve my life according to your word.\f + \fr 119:154 \ft Or “promise” \f*
Salvation \add is\add* far from \add the\add* wicked,
for they do not seek your statutes.
Your mercies \add are\add* great, O Yahweh;
preserve my life according to your ordinances.
My persecutors and enemies \add are\add* many,
\add yet\add* I do not turn aside from your testimonies.
I see \add the\add* treacherous and I feel disgust,
because they do not heed your word.
Consider\f + \fr 119:159 \ft Hebrew “See” \f* that I love your precepts;
O Yahweh, according to your loyal love preserve my life.
The ⸤whole⸥\f + \fr 119:160 \ft Literally “head” \f* of your word \add is\add* truth,
and your every righteous judgment \add endures\add* forever.
Sin/Shin
Princes persecute me without cause,
but my heart trembles because of your word.\f + \fr 119:161 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f*
I \add am\add* rejoicing over your word,
like one who finds great spoil.
I hate and abhor falsehood;
I love your law.
I praise you seven \add times\add* in the day
for your righteous ordinances.
Great peace \add is\add* for those who love your law,
and they do not have a cause for stumbling.
I hope for your salvation, O Yahweh,
and do your commands.
My soul heeds your testimonies,
and I love them exceedingly.
I heed your precepts and testimonies,
because all my ways \add are\add* before you.
Taw
Let my cry come before you, O Yahweh;
give me understanding according to your word.
Let my plea come before you;
Deliver me according to your word.\f + \fr 119:170 \ft Or “promise” \f*
Let my lips pour out praise,
because you teach me your statutes.
Let my tongue sing \add of\add* your word,\f + \fr 119:172 \ft Or “promise” \f*
because all your commands \add are\add* right.
Let your hand be my help,\f + \fr 119:173 \ft Hebrew “to help me” \f*
because I have chosen your precepts.
I long for your salvation, O Yahweh,
and your law \add is\add* my delight.
Let my soul\f + \fr 119:175 \ft Or “my life” \f* live that it may praise you,
and let your ordinances help me.
I have wandered like a lost sheep; seek your servant,
because I do not forget your commands.
